#Text=Wikimania 2008 opens at Bibliotheca Alexandrina , Egypt
#Text=Friday , July 18 , 2008
#Text=This article mentions the Wikimedia Foundation , one of its projects , or people related to it .
#Text=Wikinews is a project of the Wikimedia Foundation .
#Text=Thursday saw the start of the fourth International Wikimedia Conference , better known as Wikimania 2008.

#Text=The conference is being held in the Bibliotheca Alexandrina , a modern library with conference facilities for multiple tracks as well as a grand hall where the opening ceremony and first presentation were held .

#Text=Speakers for the opening ceremony : His Excellency Dr. Ahmed Darwish , the Egyptian Minister of State for Administrative Development , Florence Devouard , the outgoing chair of the Wikimedia Foundation , Mohamed Ibrahim the active lead volunteer , who took the initiative of approaching Bibliotheca Alexandrina to collaborate on the bidding and the organization of Wikimania 2008 along with the enthusiastic local volunteers , and finally Jakob Voss head of the program committee .
#Text=The theme of this year 's conference is " Change the shape of wisdom " , and the choice of location is seen as an outreach to the Arabic and African communities .

column1: #Text=According to Dr. Darwish , the conference has the full support of the Egyptian Prime Minister who would have attended but for a clash with a prior engagement .
#Text=In his introductory talk he described wikis as becoming more reliable and being a form of globalization which did not destroy local identity .

#Text=Talking of Egyptian efforts to improve education and make it a more continuous process he discussed increased e-Government and the fact that in this area Egypt had come in the top 25 % of UN surveyed countries .
#Text=The country 's young population is seen as a driving factor in increasing Internet use .
#Text=Optimistically , Dr Darwish spoke of the move from a two-sided situation to more collaboration between government and citizens .
#Text=Florence Devouard spoke briefly about the library , comparing their goals with those of the Wikimedia Foundation and drawing a number of parallels .
#Text=One of the projects hosted by the library is a mirror of the Internet Archive .
#Text=As a surprise announcement , she revealed that the language subcommittee had approved the creation of a new Wikipedia version for Egyptian Arabic .
#Text=Mohamed Ibrahim talked on how Alexandria winning the bid had significantly raised the profile of wiki projects within the Arab and African media .
#Text=This was evidenced at a press conference held early that afternoon .
#Text=Around six or seven TV crews were present along with at least 30 reporters .

#Text=Despite not being Western media , the focus of questioning was on academic skepticism towards Wikipedia ; the oft-repeated confusion between Wikia and the Wikimedia Foundation was dismissed when raised .
#Text=Jakob Voss , the last member of the opening ceremony team , gave a rundown of a number of statistics .
#Text=The conference received over 150 submissions for talks and workshops .
#Text=Of these approximately 75 were approved with around 100 speakers due to talk during the course of the three day conference .

#Text=Participation in the conference is around 650 attendees , coming from 47 different countries around the globe , in addition to some 80 other participants , including individuals from local and international media , sponsors representatives , BA directors and WMF advisory and board members .
#Text=At a well-attended press conference the usual issues were raised , such as the reliability of Wikipedia as a source .
#Text=It was also announced that with the stepping down of Florence Devouard as Chair of the WMF board , her successor will be Michael Snow .
#Text=Jimmy Wales gave a speech titled Freedom of speech , human rights , and free culture .
#Text=In his speech he made a comparison between the Freedom House rating with the size of the Wikipedia in that language .
#Text=He found a link between the two in the cases he examined .
#Text=Other presentations included Rhonda Shearer 's speech on media accountability , Foundation goals and plans with Sue Gardner and Erik Möller .
#Text=The day ended with a board panel providing an opportunity for discussion with the board and a question & answer segment .
#Text=This included the announcement that the new chair of the Foundation is Michael Snow .
